thread.title: Teen girl posts 'revenge porn' snaps of ex on Instagram after "volatile" nine-month relationship ends
thread.title_full: Teen girl posts 'revenge porn' snaps of ex on Instagram after "volatile" nine-month relationship ends

author: Ian Johnson
title: Teen girl posts 'revenge porn' snaps of ex on Instagram after "volatile" nine-month relationship ends
text:
Marley Wise posted naked pictures of her ex on Instagram after they split (Photo: Gazette Live) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A teenage girls claims she posted naked snaps of her ex on Instagram in revenge after the couple's "volatile" relationship ended. 
Marley Wise said she “impulsively” posted the nude shots - fearing he had done the same to her. 
Teesside Magistrates’ Court heard the act had left her ex “extremely embarrassed and humiliated” - especially after the snaps caught the eye of unwanted male admirers online. 
Wise, 19, has now been convicted under ‘revenge porn’ laws after admitting to uploading the pictures when the couple’s nine month relationship ended. 
Magistrates heard today that the victim’s life had been made a “misery" after the pictures were shared online, reports Gazette Live . 
“I don’t want anything else to do with her and would be quite happy if I never saw her again,” he said a statement. 
The court heard Wise was a teenage troublemaker who first appeared in court aged 13 for violence, but had suffered heartbreaking tragedies at a young age. Wise, 19, has now been convicted under ‘revenge porn’ laws after admitting to uploading the pictures when the couple’s nine month relationship ended (Photo: Gazette Live) 
She had landed GCSEs along with apprenticeships at both Stockton and Hartlepool Council. 
But she snapped last November 19 after “festering” over nude snaps of herself she had sent to her former partner. 
The court heard that in better times, the couple had felt it was “appropriate” to send nude pictures of themselves to each other. 
In police interview, her solicitor claimed Wise told Cleveland Police that she was also a victim of the same crime. Read More 
“The reason she did it was because he had posted images of her on the internet,” claimed Neil Taylor, mitigating. 
“She has not tried to hide from this - she accepts what she did was wrong.” Wise posted the images to Instagram (Photo: Getty) 
He added officers had a “duty” to investigate her claims if they were made in interview. 
But prosecutor Lynne Dalton carried out police checks and claimed there was “no record” of any investigation. 
The court heard the offending images were removed after an hour, with the probation service - which was ordered to look at all sentencing options including custody - claiming Wise told them she doesn’t use social media anymore. Read More 
Magistrates ordered unemployed Wise to pay £100 compensation to her victim, with the money to come from her benefits. 
The court heard she’s currently sanctioned after failing to attend appointments. 
In 2015, The Gazette reported how Wise, then from Billingham, had been mugged at Billingham Tesco. 
Wise, now of Hartland Grove, Hartlepool, was also handed a six month community order and made to pay £85 costs. Like us on Facebook
